DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Specimen Inadequate For Whole Exome Sequencing Shipping Due To Other Reason Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text describing the other reason that a tumor specimen did not meet requirements for shipping for the purpose of whole exome sequencing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Specimen Inadequate For Whole Exome Sequencing Shipping Due To Other Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement._The reason of something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for all of the exons in an individual._The act or business of transporting goods._Caused by or resulting from._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
